medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until three weeks earlier when a nonproductive cough developed. Nine days later, the cough became productive. Fever and chilliness developed with nausea, vomiting, anorexia, mild bitemporal headache, and abdominal pain after stopping azithromycin, which he took for four days. Two days before admission, he reported a mild headache, inability to arise from bed without assistance, and anorexia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prostatic carcinoma was diagnosed three years prior. The patient had a history of atrial fibrillation and a heart murmur detected during childhood. He had smoked two packs of cigarettes daily from age 16 to 36 and drank moderate amounts of alcohol.
medical_history.family_history: A brother in his 60s had an implanted defibrillator; no other relevant family history mentioned.
medical_history.social_history: The patient resided on Nantucket, Massachusetts, and had retired from a sedentary occupation. He is a sexually active homosexual man.
